page.title: 01Heybridge and the Area
page.content: Heybridge and Maldon are places with backgrounds that stretch far back into history. The importance of Maldon is illustrated in the ancient poem 'The Battle of Maldon', and there is evidence that before the river on which it once stood silted up, that Heybridge was a thriving port as long ago as 400 B.C. In the Domesday Book Heybridge (or Tidwolditun as it was then known) is recorded as being a farming community and today Maldon is still a small market town. The fields around abound with cereal crops and flour milling is still carried on today. Similarly boat building and salt refining continue. However, the area also has its share of heavy and light engineering and the service industries are increasing. An area with a past but also a future.
